intro: Rubus hirtus var. smardiaca, commonly known as the Smardiac raspberry, is a shrub native to parts of eastern North America. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its prickly stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically red when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Rubus genus, with unique variations in leaf structure and fruit morphology.
